properties.name: 03.08, 8PM: Leyon Gaines, 32
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees New OrleansA local man was fatally gunned down Saturday evening in the middle of an Uptown street. The shooting took place shortly after 6 p.m. in the 7300 block of Pitt Street, near Lowerline Street, police said. The Orleans Parish coroner\'s office identified the victim as Leyon Gaines, 32, of New Orleans. Area residents reported hearing at least three shots. Gaines fell onto the pavement near an idling car in the middle of the block. He was pronounced dead at the scene. He died from a gunshot wound to the head, New Orleans police spokeswoman Shereese Harper said. Police had no motives or suspects, she said, but a red compact car was seen leaving the scene. Gaines pleaded guilty in 1997 to possession of crack cocaine, according to court records. He was arrested early last month for possession of a stolen vehicle and for being a felon with a firearm. He had an April court date pending. Within minutes of the shooting, dozens of grieving people flocked to the site. Several people, all wearing memorial R.I.P. shirts, said Gaines and some friends had attended the funeral of a relative earlier in the day. - from the Times-Picayune

properties.name: 03.24, 2AM: 2 shot while changing tire
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees "An unknown assailant shot two men, one fatally, this morning while they were changing a flat tire on Interstate 10. The incident happened around 2 a.m. on the eastbound side of I-10, near the Carrollton Avenue exit. The NOPD responded to a call of a shooting and upon their arrival, found two men who had apparently suffered gunshot wounds to the body. One victim was pronounced dead at the scene and the other was transported to a local hospital, according to a NOPD press release. The victim who died is a 19-year-old New Orleans man. His name is being witheld until family members are notified. Police said the victims had parked in the dividing area between the Interstate and Carrollton Avenue exit to change a flat tire. The shooter then approached the vehicle and shot them, according to police." -as reported on nola.com

properties.name: 03.25, outside Passions nightclub
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees "...the second fatal shooting at the club in less than two years. According to spokeswoman Sabrina Richardson, the victim was leaving Passions, 3921 Dowman Road, when someone opened fire outside the establishment. A bouncer ran outside to check what was happening and found an adult male lying next to his car in the parking lot with multiple gunshot wounds..."The victim was pronounced dead on the scene," Richardson said. Police did not identify the victim, and said they have no suspects or motives for the crime. In October 2006, Passions was the site of another brutal shooting that left two dead. The shooting happened after Thomas Rogan, a 28-year-old security guard at Passions, stopped 29-year-old Terrell L. Dowl of New Orleans from entering the club, according to police. Dowl, who police had wanted since July 2006 on a parole violation, responded by pulling out an assault rifle and shooting Rogan in the head and body, killing him, police said. Dowl then sprayed several shots into Passions and struck a 19-year-old woman in the foot. Dowl, still towing the assault rifle, then ran from the club and headed toward the 4000 block of Dowman, police said. There, he crossed a security guard at a neighboring club named Visions, who had heard the shots and ordered Dowl to drop the weapon, police said. Dowl fired at the guard but missed, police said. The Visions security guard fired back, hitting Dowl once in the head, an injury that he died from the next day."- as reported on NOLA.com

properties.name: 04.08:  Brandon Barnes, 19
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees New Orleans police Friday arrested a 19-year-old man in connection with the fatal shooting of another 19-year-old on Tuesday in Mid-City. Timothy Jackson was booked with first-degree murder in the death of Brandon Barnes. Barnes of New Orleans and another 19-year-old man were shot Tuesday about 6:30 p.m. near Palmyra and South Rendon Streets. Police found one victim at Palmyra and South Rendon, and the other around the corner in the 200 block of South Jefferson Davis Parkway. Barnes died about a half hour later at University Hospital. Detective Anthony Pardo determined that Jackson was responsible for the killing, said police spokeswoman Jonette Williams. After an arrest warrant was obtained, Jackson was arrested at Interstate 10 Service Road and North Hullen Street by New Orleans police and the Jefferson Parish Sheriff\'s Office. Court records showed Jackson pleaded guilty on March 7 to possession of cocaine and was placed on probation for three years. A day before he was killed, records showed, Barnes was in Criminal District Court in connection with a charge of carrying a concealed weapon, first offense. His trial was to have taken place on April 28. -from the Times-Picayune

properties.name: 04.17, 5PM: Shavers Murder Witness found in gutter
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees Guy McEwen, 20, was a key witness in the Shavers murder case. Though he testified he couldn\'t ID the shooter, he was riding in Shaver\'s car at the time- he kept his mouth shut. A week after the acquittal of David Bonds in that murder, McEwen was shot at over 25 times and expired in the gutter. He was 20 years old.

properties.name: 04.19, 1 PM: Lorne Simms, 20
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees In the 7th Ward, 1st District police found the body of Lorne Simms, 20, of New Orleans, lying on the sidewalk in the 1400 block of North Johnson Street, between Kerlerec and Columbus streets, about noon, police spokeswoman Sabrina Richardson said. Simms died from a single gunshot wound to the head, said John Gagliano, chief investigator for the coroner\'s office. Several neighbors said they had heard two shots. Police did not immediately have any leads, but investigators were "canvassing the area for any possible witnesses who can identify the suspect or suspects," Richardson said. -The Times-Picayune

properties.name: 04.25, 1pm: 3 Murdered in Home Invasion, Opening Day of Jazzfest
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees "Three masked gunmen dressed in black shot three people, two fatally and one critically, in a Seventh Ward home invasion midday Friday, police said. The shooting took place shortly before 1 p.m. in the 2300 block of Laharpe Street, roughly eight blocks from the scene of the New Orleans Jazz and Heritage Festival at the fairgrounds...three masked gunmen dressed in black invaded a home Friday about 1 p.m. in the 2300 block of Laharpe Street and fatally shot three New Orleans people inside. The coroner\'s office released the identity of the third victim, Johnny Crawford, 20. Margaret Wells, 21, and Crawford died on the scene. Tony Wells, 22, died less than three hours later at a hospital. "- Ramon Antonio Vargas, The Times-Picayune

properties.name: 04.26, 3:26AM. Louis Bertholotte, 25 , 1st Saturday of Jazzfest
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees "A 25-year-old New Orleans man was fatally shot inside a 7th Ward bar early Saturday, marking the fourth homicide in that neighborhood in a 15-hour span, the New Orleans Police Department said. Louis Bertholotte was shot multiple times in the torso at 3:26 a.m. in the New Edition bar in the 2100 block of A.P. Tureaud Avenue, department spokesman Garry Flot said. Bertholotte died at the bar, which is about five blocks south of St. Augustine High School. An autopsy confirmed Bertholotte suffered multiple gunshot wounds, said chief coroner\'s investigator John Gagliano, who released his identity. " Ramon Antonio Vargas, The Times-Picayune

properties.name: 04.27, 8:20 PM.  Double Homicide, 1st Sunday Jazz Fest
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees "Two people, including a 17-year-old, were fatally shot Sunday night in the greater Treme neighborhood, New Orleans police said. First District Task Force officers heard shots about 8:20 p.m. and found the young men in the 2600 block of Dumaine Street, near North Broad Street, police spokesman Garry Flot said. The 17-year-old, who lay in a residential driveway, died at the scene, between Broad and North Dorgenois Street. A 20-year-old man, who was lying on a sidewalk, died later Sunday in a hospital, Flot said. The identities of the victims were withheld." --From the Times-Picayune

properties.name: 05.01, Double Homicide, 2d Thursday Jazzfest
properties.description: Posted by NolafugeesNew Orleans, LA"Earlier Thursday, 1st District officers found a 20-year-old and a 17-year-old shot inside a home in the 2900 block of Banks Street in Mid-City, according to Williams. Paramedics pronounced the 20-year-old dead on the scene, Tate said. The 17-year-old was taken to University Hopsital with a gunshot wound to the calf. The injury was not life-threatening, Tate said."

properties.name: 05.02, 12 AM.  2 shot, 1 dead, 2d Friday Jazzfest
properties.description: Posted by NolafugeesNew Orleans"Lakeisha Taylor was killed and a man injured in a double shooting that broke out around midnight in the courtyard of the Iberville housing development in the 1400 block of Conti Street, police said. According to the New Orleans Police Department, officers found an undentified woman with a lethal gunshot wound to the head and a 24-year-old man also shot in the head. The woman was pronounced dead on the scene, department spokeswoman Jonette Williams said. According to Jeb Tate, New Orleans EMS spokesman, paramedics took the 24-year-old to the trauma center at University Hospital. Doctors listed him in critical condition. Police have no suspect or motive. This is at least the 68th homicide NOPD has been called to investigate this year."-Times-Picayune

properties.description: Posted by NolafugeesNew Orleans, LA22-year-old Brandon McCue [was] shot multiple times in the driveway of a trailer park east of Wilson Avenue on the 7700 block of Chef Menteur Highway. Police later arrested Christopher Wells, 24, and booked him with the second-degree murder of McCue, spokeswoman Jonette Williams said in a release. -Times-Picayune

properties.name: 05.05, 9PM
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees New Orleans, LAA man who was shot and seriously wounded in eastern New Orleans Monday night has died of his injuries, according to the New Orleans Police Department. According to investigators, officers responding to the 9 p.m. shooting found the unidentified victim lying in front of a home on 10021 block of Castlewood Street with multiple gunshot wounds to the face. Radio reports indicated that a red car was in the middle of the street. When paramedics arrived, they pronounced the man dead, NOPD spokeswoman Sabrina Richardson said in a written statement. Police have no suspect or motive. This is the third murder in eastern New Orleans since Sunday, and at least the 71st murder police have had to investigate this year. -Times-Picayune

Investigators found narcotics nearby. -Times-Picayune

properties.name: 05.13, 930PM
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees New OrleansNew Orleans police arrested one local man and have issued an arrest warrant for his brother in the city\'s most recent murder. An unidentified man was gunned down Tuesday night at about 9:30 p.m. in the 3400 block of South Claiborne Avenue, near Louisiana Avenue, in Central City, according to a NOPD news release. Police arrested Andre Hankton, 30, and booked him with second-degree murder shortly after the slaying. A warrant was issued for his brother, Telly Hankton, 31. Detectives learned the victim, in his vehicle, was being chased by gunmen in another car. At some point, the victim tried to flee from his car and run away. The suspects hit the victim with their vehicle and then shot him, police said. One gunman exited the car and ran and the other drove away. The vehicle was located shortly later and officers apprehended Andre Hankton, police said. -Times-Picayune

Stewart, 23, was gunned down Tuesday night at about 9:30 p.m. in the 3400 block of South Claiborne Avenue, near Louisiana Avenue, in Central City, according to a NOPD news release. Detectives learned the victim, in his vehicle, was being chased by gunmen in another car. At some point, the victim tried to flee from his car and run away. The suspects hit the victim with their vehicle and then shot him, police said. One gunman exited the car and ran and the other drove away. The vehicle was located shortly later and officers apprehended Andre Hankton, police said. -Times-Picayune

properties.name: 05.17, 3:30AM: Michael Reed, 21, Dalvin Rainey, 24
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees Fourth District officers responded around 3:30 a.m. to a report of a shooting at L.B. Landry Avenue and De Armas Street, near the base of the Crescent City Connection bridge, police spokeswoman Sabrina Richardson said in a news release. They found two men, Michael Reed, 21, and Dalvin Rainey, 24, inside a car, both suffering from several bullet wounds. The 21-year-old victim was pronounced dead at the scene, while the 24-year-old man died within hours at a local hospital, Richardson said. Their identities were not immediately released because their families had not yet been notified. According to detectives, as the victims\' vehicle entered the intersection, one or more shooters, possibly in a red vehicle, approached them and fired several times, then fled the scene, Richardson said. -The TImes-Picayune

Lewis, 23. -Times-Picayune

properties.name: 05.22, ???: Kenneth Lewis, 46; Brenda Joyce, 57
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees The mystery of what caused the death of a 46-year-old man and a 57-year-old woman found in the rear of a home at 3124 Orleans Avenue was solved today when an autopsy revealed the two died of stab wounds. Kenneth Lewis and Brenda Joyce Jackson died of "multiple stab wounds" said John Gagliano, chief investigator for the coroner\'s office, which conducted the autopsy Thursday and officially identified the pair, whose deaths were "unclassified" Wednesday. "There were more than 10 stab wounds in each body," Gagliano said. Police Wednesday said the bodies were too badly decomposed to determine their identities or the cause of death. Authorities closed a portion of Orleans Avenue from North Rendon Street to Lopez Street for hours Wednesday while New Orleans Police officers and FBI agents gathered evidence from the crime scene. A son of Kenneth Lewis discovered the bodies in the home Wednesday and called police. Neighbors said the son was "screaming and wailing." Relatives described Lewis as a "Wild Man" member of Fi Yi Yi Mardi Gras Indians who liked to sip his beer and chat. On Sundays, he\'d gather with a tiny congregation at the Holy Aid Comfort Spiritual Church at 1644 Villere St. and lead the group in prayer. Charles Andrews, a half-brother of Lewis, said Jackson was a short-order cook who his brother was with for years, but he knew little else about her. -The Times-Picayune

properties.name: 05.25, 1:30AM: Unknown
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees 1:An unidentified person fell victim to a murderer in the 9th Ward this morning. Police couldn\'t immediately provide details on the gender or age of the victim .The murder happened at approximately 1:32 a.m., on the corner of Lesseps and Marais streets. That first sentence is, we think, what they call "passive voice" in English Class. NOMB is sending over our copy of Elements of Style by Strunk and White as soon as we can find it. 2:A man was wounded by a New Orleans police officer after he apparently drew a gun during a traffic stop in 9th Ward Tuesday night. The officer, who was not identified by police, pulled over a car with at least four people inside during a traffic stop at Lesseps and Marais streets at about 8:30 p.m., according to a police spokesman. As the officer approached the car, the driver exited, drew a gun and aimed it at the officer, police said. The officer shot the driver in the shoulder. The other people in the car fled. One was captured and was being held by police. The other two remained at large. Police said narcotics were found in the vehicle. Seems there was a good bit of action over on Lesseps and Marais last night, eh? -The New Orleans Murder Blog

properties.name: 06.09, MacArthur Carter, 45
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees A 45-year-old man was fatally shot in the head in his Central City home on Monday evening, according to a New Orleans Police Department spokesman. The man was identified as MacArthur Carter by John Gagliano, chief investigator of the Orleans Parish coroner\'s office. Gagliano said his office is preliminarily treating the death as a homicide, although a definite conclusion will be made after an autopsy today . Sixth District officers found Carter at 1944 Philip Street while responding to a report of a "male down." He was pronounced dead on the scene by EMS technicians. The case is being investigated by Homicide Detective Harold Wischan. -Times-Picayune

properties.name: 06.18, 1130AM: Denzil Williams, 18
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees Denzil Williams, 18, was killed in an Algiers shooting late Thursday morning.Police responded to a report of a shooting in the 1700 block of Hero Boulevard in old Algiers around 11:30 a.m. The victim, who was killed down the block from his family home, had several gunshot wounds to the body and head. -from NewOrleansMurderBlog

properties.name: 06.25, 10PM: 2 Shot, 1 Killed
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees Gunfire killed a 34-year-old man and wounded a 39-year-old woman in the Hollygrove neighborhood Wednesday night, capping off a bloody day in which at least three people were murdered and two were injured in three separate incidents, according to the New Orleans Police Department. Officers responded to a call of a shooting in the 3400 block of Hollygrove Street shortly before 10 p.m. When they arrived, they found the woman lying in a driveway, and the 34-year-old man not far from her, lying in a vacant lot. The man appeared to have gunshot wounds to the chest, and the woman had been shot in the foot, according to a press release by NOPD spokeswoman Shereese Harper. Responding paramedics pronounced the 34-year-old man dead on the scene and took the 39-year-old woman to University Hospital. -Times-Picayune

properties.name: 06.25, 6AM: Victor Russell
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees A 48-year-old New Orleans man fell victim to a murderer in the Lower 9th Ward this morning, a spokesman for the New Orleans coroner\'s office said. Victor Russell appears to have died from gunshot wounds, said John Gagliano, the coroner\'s chief investigator. Someone found Russell dead in the 6300 block of North Rampart Street and alerted the police, Gagliano said. The New Orleans Police Department has not been reached for comment, but media reports indicate that there are no suspects in the murder. Media reports also indicated that someone coming home from work found Russell dead inside his home. Court records show Russell dabbled in the world of drugs. He pled guilty to a 1989 possession of crack and received a one-year hard labor prison sentence in 1990. Six years after receiving his first prison sentence, Russell received seven years of hard labor in prison after pleading guilty to a possession of crack charge stemming from a 1995 arrest. In 2004, Russell pled guilty to a possession of cocaine charge, receiving a two-year prison sentence. A judge suspended it and placed him on active probation, court records show. He was off probation by May 2007, court records show, but police arrested him once more in June 2007, booking him with a possession of crack charge in June 2007. At the time authorities believe he was murdered, Russell was facing the charge stemming from that arrest in court. -The Times-Picayune

properties.name: 06.25, 9PM: 2 Shot, 1 Killed
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees a hail of gunfire killed a 22-year-old man and wounded a 14-year-old boy as they sat inside a sports utility vehicle at the corner of Bienville Street and North Claiborne Avenue. Bullets hit the 22-year-old in the chest, back and stomach, according to a preliminary incident report from the NOPD. The boy had wounds on the the thigh, ankle and leg. Responding paramedics took both to University Hospital, where the 22-year-old later died, police said. Doctors listed the 14-year-old in serious condition, police said. -Times-Picayune

properties.name: 07.01:  3:30AM, 17 yr old female
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees An unidentified woman was found shot to death on the 2100 block of Franklin Avenue early this morning, police said in a statement. Fifth District officers responded to a reports of a shooting and found the woman inside a home in the St. Roch neighborhood with a single gunshot wound, according to New Orleans Police Department spokesman Garry Flot. The incident occurred around 3:30 a.m., and emergency responders pronounced the victim dead at the scene. Police are still investigating the shooting. -The Times-Picayune

properties.name: 07.06, 330AM: Mervin Simon, 22
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees Five people were wounded in four separate shootings, one person was killed and nine armed robberies were reported across New Orleans over the three-day holiday weekend. The busy weekend for police coincided with crowds in the city for the Essence Festival. But this year\'s event triggered fewer arrests than last year and the violent crimes reported were far from the Essence activities. In all, 96 people were arrested in downtown New Orleans over the weekend, compared with 168 arrests over the same festival weekend last year, New Orleans police said in a news release. The fatal shooting occurred Sunday about 3:20 a.m. in the 2300 block of A.P. Tureaud Avenue in the 7th Ward, according to the NOPD, which released details Monday of the incidents. Mervin Simon, 22, of New Orleans, had an altercation inside the Duck Off bar with two other men. The two suspects followed him outside and shot him as he walked toward his vehicle. He was shot in the chest. -The Times-Picayune

properties.name: 07.11, 12AM: Male, 34
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees One man was shot in the head and another died after his throat was cut in two overnight murder in eastern New Orleans, police said. The shooting death occurred around midnight at the intersection of Chef Menteur Highway and Laine Avenue, according to the police department. Officers found the 34-year-old victim lying in the street from an apparent gunshot wound in the head. He was pronounced dead at the scene. A 32-year-old woman was also shot in the arm, and is listed in stable condition. The names of the victims are being withheld until the family can be notified, police said. Detectives are working to gather evidence and identify a suspect, a release said. -The Times-Picayune

properties.name: 07.11, 3AM: Male, 30
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees In a separate incident, police around 3 a.m. found a 30-year-old man suffering from a stab wound to the throat in the 7300 block of Read Boulevard. Medical officials arrived soon after, but the man was pronounced dead on the scene, according to police. The man\'s name is being withheld until family members are notified. Police have identified 22-year-old Mangno Portillo as a suspect in the stabbing. Portillo is described as 5\'1", 120 pounds, and was wearing blue jean shorts and no shirt. He is now wanted for second-degree murder. -The Times-Picayune

properties.name: 07.15, 422AM: Terrence Sporty T Vine
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees Unknown gunmen toting an AK-47 opened fire on the exterior of a FEMA trailer in Gentilly this morning, murdering a former local rapper who was sleeping inside, according to the New Orleans Police Department. Terence Vine, a rapper known to friends and fans as "Sporty T," was in bed when the gunmen sprayed his trailer with bullets, several of which struck his body, according to police. John Gagliano, chief investigator for the New Orleans coroner\'s office, said Vine was 39, but family members and Garry Flot, a police spokesman, said they believed Vine was 41... ... At 4:22 a.m. Tuesday, NOPD received a "shots fired" call from 5150 Painters St., Flot said. When police officers and other emergency workers arrived, they found the exterior of Vine\'s trailer riddled with at least 28 bullet holes. Inside, they found Vine wounded. Paramedics pronounced him dead at the scene, said Jeb Tate, a New Orleans EMS spokesman. At least three rounds exited the other side of the trailer. One round lodged in the driver\'s seat of a black Nissan Pathfinder, parked in the driveway, that belonged to Vine\'s sister Michele Vine. Another blew out her rear driver\'s side tire, and another shattered the rear driver\'s side window. Det. Michael S. McCleery is heading the investigation. Police had no motive, suspects or witnesses, according to Flot. ...Vine joined a rap trio known as the "Ninja Crew" when he was 14, recording three albums. He then signed as a solo artist with Big Boy Records and recorded more than a dozen albums with them, the sister said. Eight years ago, he left the label and started his own Sporty Records, where he recorded the last of his work. Terence Vine was the second member of the Ninja Crew to be murdered, Sheila Vine said. The only surviving member, a tall, heavyset man identifying himself as "Gregory D," pulled up to the home this morning and embraced Sheila Vine as he said, "I\'m sorry," through quiet sobs. He led her away from the trailer and later declined comment. -The Times Picayune

properties.name: 07.18, 1015PM: DeShawn Stewart, 18
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees The weekend\'s reported killings began Friday at 10:15 p.m. when someone shot Deshawn Stewart, 18, in the 1500 block of Prieur Street. Police on Saturday identified Darrell Lewis, 22, as the suspected shooter... ...At the time of his death, Stewart was serving the first of two years of probation after pleading guilty to a possession of stolen automobile charge. -The Times-Picayune

properties.name: 07.18, 1040PM: Anthony Brooks, 20
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees 20-year-old Anthony Brooks of New Orleans died of several gunshot wounds in the 3100 block of Marais Street, where officers found him lying in the street. No suspects have been identified by police. -The Times-Picayune

properties.name: 07.20, 1020AM: Kerry Emery, 28
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees The second shooting happened around 10:20 a.m. in the 3300 block of Clouet Street in the Ninth Ward. Fifth District officers responded to a call of a shooting and found Kerry Emery, 28, lying in the street, suffering from apparent gunshot wounds to the torso. John Gagliano, the New Orleans coroner\'s chief investigator, identified Emery, who died on the scene. He appears to have died from the gunshots, Gagliano said, but the coroner\'s office will know the exact cause of death after they perform an autopsy tomorrow. Homicide Detective Nicholas Gernon is in charge of that investigation. -Times-Picayune

properties.name: 07.20, 130AM: Random Latino
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees The first incident occurred at about 1:30 a.m., at the intersection of North Derbigny and Spain Streets. The man has been identified as a man living in New Orleans who coroner\'s investigators believe may have been from Latin America, said John Gagliano, the New Orleans coroner\'s chief investigator. Gagliano declined to release the 41-year-old\'s identity because the coroner\'s office hasn\'t yet located his family, nor have they determined exactly where he was from. According to investigators, Fifth District officers responded to a call of a shooting and found the man lying inside a vehicle, with apparent gunshot wounds to the torso. He was pronounced dead on the scene. Homicide Detective Regina Williams is in charge of the investigation. -From the Times-Picayune

properties.name: 07.20, 7PM: Marvin Louis, 19
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees The last murder\'s shots were fired at approximately 7 p.m. Uptown, according to police, and they claimed the life of Marvin Louis, 19, of New Orleans, according to Gagliano. Officers responding to the call, in the 8700 block of Belfast Street, arrived to find Louis lying in the street. He had apparently sustained a gunshot wound to the head. EMS paramedics pronounced Louis dead on the scene. Investigators have no motive or suspects in the shooting, and homicide Detective Catherine Beckett is in charge of the investigation. -The Times-Picayune

properties.name: 07.21, 1 PM: Lawrence Robinson, 21
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees Robert Smith, of 1736 General Ogden St., is wanted for the second-degree murder of Lawrence Robinson, 21, according to NOPD spokeswoman Sabrina Richardson. Smith is 5 feet, 9 inches tall and weighs approximately 150 pounds, Richardson said. Detectives believe Smith fired multiple bullets into Robinson\'s chest and legs. Authorities found Robinson dead inside of the Happy Jack Social and Pleasure Club, 1418 South Rampart St., after responding to a call of gunshots fired just after 1 p.m. on Monday... ...Robinson\'s slaying followed a violent weekend, in which five other men fell victim to murder in five separate incidents from Friday to Sunday. The Happy Jack Social and Pleasure Club is located in a building near the NOPD\'s 6th District station. Police said it appears to be a meeting room, but were trying to figure out the exact nature of the establishment, Assistant Superintendent Marlon Defillo said Monday. -The Times-Picayune

properties.name: 07.24, 827PM: Yen Nguyen, 72
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees Yen Nguyen, 14362 Dwyer Road, died after apparently "sustaining trauma to the body," according to Jonette Williams, New Orleans Police Department spokesman. Officers responding to an 8:27 p.m. "female down" call found Nguyen in her home, lying face down in a "pool of blood," according to a police record. They concluded that someone had possibly dealt her "trauma to the head" and wrote up a report classifying the incident as a homicide... ..."She was a nice lady," said Thuc Nguyen, who attended Mary Queen of Vietnam Catholic Church with the deceased. -The Times-Picayune

properties.name: 07.26, 930PM: Ryen J. Tate, 20
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees Saturday night gunfire in Central City killed a 20-year-old man and injured two others, according to the New Orleans Police Department. Ryen J. Tate died of multiple gunshot wounds at the scene of the 9:30 p.m. shooting in the 1300 block of South Saratoga Street, said John Gagliano, the New Orleans coroner\'s chief investigator. The two other unidentified victims were hospitalized, according to an NOPD statement. The victims had already left the scene when paramedics arrived, said Jeb Tate, a New Orleans EMS spokesman. Ryen Tate was murdered in a sparsely-traveled block littered with crushed drink cans and other trash, about a minute drive from where authorities believed he was living... ...Tate had a criminal record: he spent time in criminal court battling charges stemming from drug-related arrests. On July 10, 2007, he received three concurrent prison sentences stemming from charges he was booked with after three separate arrests: charged with crack possession in December 2006; charged with marijuana possession in March 2007, alongside another defendant; and a distribution of crack charge one month later. Tate, who would have turned 21 on Aug. 30, was sentenced to two years in prison for each of the crack-related charges and six months for the marijuana charge. -The Times-Picayune

properties.name: 07.27, 719PM: Gerald Thorton, 20
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees A 20-year-old man was murdered Sunday night on the lawn of an Algiers home in the 6300 block of Kingston Court, about a block away from where he lived, according to the New Orleans Police Department. Gerald Thorton, identified by John Gagliano, the chief investigator for the New Orleans coroner\'s office, died of multiple gunshot wounds, said Garry Flot, an NOPD spokesman... ...Just 12 days before his death, Thorton had pled guilty to an illegal possession of a concealed weapon charge, stemming from a June 30 arrest, according to court records. Records show New Orleans police arrested him alongside a defendant who later pled guilty to possession of marijuana. Thorton\'s sentence was one year of inactive probation. Thorton\'s family members declined to comment. However, shortly after her family\'s refusal, a woman standing in the middle of the roadway broke the scene\'s quiet. Her raised voice quivering, she asked, "What\'s the story going to be on? That all these black boys keep getting killed before they even turn 20?" -The Times-Picayune Moments after the 7:19 p.m. shooting, a white SUV with tinted windows fled the scene, speeding down Kingston toward Sullen Street, Flot said.

properties.name: 08.03 1030PM:
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees New Orleans police booked a 22-year-old man with second-degree murder in connection with a Sunday night shooting in the 3100 block of Bruxelles Street. Clarence Singleton was charged after being treated for a dog bite he received while running from police, according to NOPD spokesman Garry Flot. Flot said a Third District officer on patrol at the intersection of Paris Avenue and North Broad Street heard shots being fired about 10:15 p.m. and drove in the direction of the gunfire, Flot said. When the officer reached the 3100 block of Bruxelles, he saw a man with a handgun and told him to drop the weapon, the spokesman said. The man, identified by police as Singleton, refused and pointed the weapon at the officer, at which time the officer then fired several rounds but missed, Flot said. Singleton then ran into an alleyway of a home. As S.W.A.T., canine and military units searched for him, they found an unidentified man who had been shot and was lying on the ground in the rear yard of a home with a handgun in his possession, Flot said. Emergency medical technicians took the victim to a local hospital where he died. Officers also found a rifle on the scene, Flot said. Shortly afterwards, the canine unit located Singleton hiding under a house in the 1700 block of Treasure Street. Singleton refused to surrender and the canine was sent in after him, Flot said. Singleton was taken to a local hospital where he was treated for a dog bite to his leg. Flot said officers found a handgun on that scene. -Times-Picayune

properties.name: 08.03: 2 men
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees New Orleans police found the bodies of two men early Sunday inside of a vehicle in the Gentilly area, police spokesman Garry Flot said. The men had been shot to death, police said. The New Orleans coroner\'s office was not able to positively establish the identities of the men as of Sunday night, said John Gagliano, the coroner\'s chief investigator. One has been described as a 24-year-old local man, Flot said. Police responding to a call shortly after midnight found the two men, who were pronounced dead on the scene, Flot said. Detectives determined that the incident originated at Hamburg and Lafreniere streets when two men approached the victims and began firing weapons, Flot said. The victims\' vehicle came to a stop eight blocks away at Mandolin and Hamburg streets, where police were called. The two gunmen fled the scene, he said. -The Times-Picayune

properties.name: 08.10, 430AM: Devin Legaux, 33
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees someone intentionally ran over a 33-year-old Slidell resident with a car, killing him at the intersection of Pauger and North Rampart streets, authorities said. Devin Legaux died on the scene from rollover-type injuries, said John Gagliano, the coroner\'s chief investigator. The New Orleans coroner\'s office classified the incident as a homicide. Legaux had been walking with another man toward the intersection when an unknown driver struck the man and then headed northbound, police said. Officers received the call about a man down near the intersection about 4:30 a.m. Legaux was alive when police arrived, but was later pronounced dead by emergency medical technicians. Detectives are still gathering evidence on the suspect and the vehicle. Legaux had a couple of run-ins with the law during his life. He pled guilty to a charge of unauthorized entry of an inhabited dwelling and a charge of unauthorized use of a motor vehicle on Feb. 5, 1998, according to criminal court records. On Sept. 12, 2004, the Slidell Police Department booked him with aggravated assault. No resolution for that case was available Sunday night. -Times-Picayune

properties.name: 08.11 330AM: Antoine C. Pierre, 27
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees Antoine C. Pierre, of New Orleans, died of a gunshot wound to the chest, said John Gagliano, chief investigator for the Orleans Parish coroner\'s office. Detectives learned that the shooting took place at the intersection of Josephine and Carondolet streets in Central City. Police said two unknown men armed with an assault rifle and a handgun opened fire on Pierre. The suspects fled on foot and Pierre drove a couple blocks before coming to a stop. -Times-Picayune

properties.name: 08.11 Jessica Hawk, 32
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees

properties.name: 08.11, 7AM: ??, Male, 43
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees Later, shortly after 7 a.m., police responded to a shooting in the 3700 block of Dryades Street in the Milan neighborhood. They found a 43-year-old man inside his home with a gunshot wound to the chest. He was pronounced dead at the scene. His identity has not been released by the coroner\'s office. Police said three gunmen had approached the victim and forced him inside the home in an apparent robbery. They demanded money, shot the man and then ran away. -Times-Picayune

properties.name: 08.16, 130PM: Travain Jones, 20 & Bryant Langston, 17
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees two New Orleans men were shot to death in a vehicle Uptown. Travain Jones, 20, died on the scene, and Bryant Langston, 17, died shortly afterward at University Hospital, according to Orleans Parish chief coroner\'s investigator John Gagliano. Langston was three weeks shy of his 18th birthday. Police said they responded to reports of gunshots around 1 p.m. and found Jones and Langston, each shot multiple times in the head and body, sitting in a vehicle on Bordeaux Street near Laurel Street. Witnesses told detectives that two armed men wearing dark clothing and dreadlocks fled the scene on foot toward Annunciation Street. -The Times-Picayune

properties.name: 08.16, 245PM: Tyone Nions, 33
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees a 33-year-old man was shot in Treme and left to die on the gravel along the edge of North Roman Street. Gagliano identified the victim as Tyone Nions, 33, of New Orleans. Nions was killed about 2:30 p.m.on North Roman Street, between Ursulines Avenue and Gov. Nicholls Street. Police said they had no suspects or motive. Family members and neighbors were generally unwilling to speak with reporters about the incident or the victim, though some neighbors talked about the senselessness of the shooting. "That dude didn\'t do nothing to nobody. He just drank his Red Bull," said one man who didn\'t want to be identified, receiving nods of approval from others who also declined to speak further about the victim or what happened. -The Times-Picayune

properties.name: 08.19, 1140PM: James A Jones,  39
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees Gunfire in the Iberville housing development took the life of a 39-year-old New Orleans man Tuesday night, according to the New Orleans Police Department. The unidentified man died on the ground of a rear driveway in the 300 block of North Robertston Street, said NOPD spokesman Officer Garry Flot. Police responding to a call at about 11:40 p.m. found the victim suffering from a gunshot wound to the body. Paramedics later arrived and pronounced him dead.

properties.name: 08.21, 1200PM: Davon Mark Hunter, 19
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees  At about noon on Wednesday, a 19-year-old man was gunned down in the 6th Ward at the same intersection where a man was killed over the weekend. The midday shootout marked the city\'s ninth killing in the past 10 days. The man was shot several times in the body at the intersection of Gov. Nicholls and North Roman streets, said New Orleans Police Officer Garry Flot. The victim was later identified by the Orleans Parish Coroner\'s Office as Davon Mark Hunter, 19, of New Orleans. Paramedics loaded him onto a stretcher and into an ambulance as stunned neighborhood residents looked on. Detectives scoured the intersection for bullet casings. The victim later died at University Hospital. Hunter had been implicated and arrested in several violent crime cases, but each was dropped or refused by the district attorney\'s office, according to court records. He was arrested for shooting a neighborhood rival in Treme in 2006, booked in April 2007 with armed robbery and attempted murder, and booked a month later in a separate carjacking and battery case. The scene of his killing is familiar to police. Homicide detectives stood on the same block last weekend investigating the shooting death of a 33-year-old local man. Tyone Nions was shot at about 2:30 p.m. Saturday. The investigation into that slaying is ongoing. -Times-Picayune

properties.name: 08.22, 200AM:  Keenon M. McCann, 32
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees Keenon M. McCann died on the sidewalk of the 6100 block of Dreux Avenue after someone fired multiple bullets into his body, said John Gagliano, the coroner\'s chief investigator. The shooting that took McCann\'s life broke out shortly before 2 a.m. According to an NOPD incident log, it appears McCann was inside a house on the block with his girlfriend. The girlfriend told authorties that McCann received a call from someone telling him to "come outside." When he stepped out, McCann was gunned down, according to the incident log. Witnesses later told police that a white Lexus sped away from the area. Emerency workers were alerted, and NOPD officers found the 32-year-old man lying on the sidewalk, his body shot several times, said NOPD spokeswoman Shereese Harper in a statement. -Times-Picayune

properties.name: 08.22, 600PM: Allen Ivery, 24
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees 2000 block of Felicity Street - Central City - District 6 A gunman riding a green bicycle along the sidewalk opened fire at about 6 p.m. on Ivery, 24, who was driving a black Buick Regal riverbound on Felicity. Ivery\'s vehicle hit a utility pole in the middle of the block and eventually came to a halt after crashing into a fence at the intersection of Felicity and South Rampart streets. He was pronounced dead at the scene. The gunman abandoned the bicycle and ran away. -Times-Pic

properties.name: 08.25, 100PM: Kenel Schneckenburg, 24
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees On Sunday afternoon, two men opened fire and murdered a 24-year-old New Orleans man who was once accused of plotting to kill an 11-year-old. Kenel K. Schneckenburg was driving north in the 1700 block of New Orleans Street in the 7th Ward about 1 p.m. when two men took aim at his car and fired several bullets, according to a New Orleans Police Department incident log. One of the bullets hit Schneckenburg in the chest, said John Gagliano, the coroner\'s chief investigator. New Orleans EMS Paramedics later arrived and took him to University Hospital where he died during emergency surgery, Gagliano said. According to court records, Schneckenburg spent two years in prison after pleading guilty to a 2004 crack possession charge. Criminal court Judge Julian Parker also sentenced Schneckenburg to six months behind bars in 2006 for "improper language (and) harassment" during his role in a jailhouse plot to kill an 11-year-old, who was the only living eyewitness to a 2003 street killing in which the victim\'s sister was gunned down in a daytime ambush. Schneckenburg has had other serious run-ins with the law, including arrests for murder that never resulted in charges. In 2001, Schneckenburg was booked with two counts of first-degree murder for the fatal shootings of Reginald Foley, 16, and Julian Paige, 24, outside Paige\'s home on St. Ferdinand Street. Prosecutors under former District Attorney Harry Connick refused to charge him in either killing. He was also indicted in 2007 for the murder of Jealine Brown. Police believe Brown was murdered on her bed by burglars who broke into her home the morning of Jan. 5, 2007, in search of money and drugs. The District Attorney\'s Office declined to prosecute the first-degree murder charge, according to court records. -Times-Picayune

properties.name: 08.27, 600AM: Tyrone Banks
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees Just before daybreak Tuesday, an unidentified man was gunned down in the 9th Ward and left facedown on a gravel sidewalk to die. When police arrived in the 1100 block of Bartholomew Street at about 6 a.m., they found the victim shot multiple times, according to department spokesman Garry Flot. Paramedics pronounced him dead on the scene. The 25- to 30-year-old man, who police say was wearing a "golf-type pullover shirt," had nothing but a piece of paper in his jean pockets, making it impossible for authorities to immediately identify him, according to New Orleans coroner\'s chief investigator John Gagliano. The coroner may not be able to positively identify him until later this evening or tomorrow, he said. Police were called to the scene after neighbors reported hearing up to six gunshots. The murder scene caught the attention of both sleepy-eyed adults and children, clad in uniforms, on their way to school. -Times-Picayune

properties.name: 08.27, 730PM:  Justin Laird
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees A man was shot Wednesday night and found dead in a spot not far from an Algiers apartment complex where -- according to neighborhood residents -- shots were fired weeks aqo in the air and in the ground "just for fun." The man, who did not have any identification on him, was pronounced dead at the scene, said Officer Jonette Williams, a New Orleans Police Department spokeswoman. The shooting occurred about 7:30 p.m., she said, and his body, with a gunshot wound to the torso, was found in the backyard of a home in the 1500 block of Murl Street. Police late Wednesday had no motive or suspects. Christopher Smith, 17, said he led police to the body who he said was Justin Laird. Smith said he attended school with Laird\'s brother, at O. Perry Walker High School in Algiers. Cedric Laird, who described himself as an uncle of the deceased, said Justin did not attend school, but the teenager spent a lot of time with his pregnant girlfriend and her 1-year-old daughter from another relationship. Cedric Laird, said he was on his computer, when he heard several shots. Laird said he moved into the neighborhood in January and recently witnessed a small group of people in the Gilmore Park apartment complex, part of which fenced off by razor wire, shooting a gun in the air and in the ground "for no reason." He said he called the police to report the incident, but the police didn\'t find the weapon. "It\'s always been a problem with the guys who live there," Laird said. -Times-Picayune

properties.name: 08.28 1AM: Thomas Byrne, 40
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees

properties.name: 08.28: Bludgeoned Woman's Decomposing Body
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees New Orleans Police have opened a murder investigation into the death of a woman whose half-naked, bludgeoned body was found weeks ago inside an abandoned bowling alley in eastern New Orleans. Real estate agents exploring the former Sugar Bowl Lanes at 7716 Chef Menteur Hwy. made the grisly discovery on Aug. 28., authorities said. The Orleans Parish Coroner\'s office first released information on the death on Wednesday. The woman, whose identity has not been released, appeared to be in her 30s, said John Gagliano, chief investigator for the coroner\'s office. The body was in an advanced stage of decomposition. An autopsy conducted a day after the discovery revealed the woman had multiple fractures to the face. She had been beaten about the head extensively. The case was ruled a murder and the NOPD\'s homicide division is investigating. -Times-Picayune

properties.name: 08.30 12:40PM: Damion McCall, 17
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees

properties.name: 09.06, 11AM: Robert Santinac, 20
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees Robert Santinac, who lived somewhere on Music Street, was the city\'s first murder victim since Aug. 30, a day before New Orleans officials ordered residents to evacuate ahead of Hurricane Gustav, said Orleans Parish Coroner\'s investigator John Gagliano. According to New Orleans Police Department spokesman Garry Flot, officers who responded to an 11:15 a.m. call about gunfire in the 1600 block of Music Street found Santinac inside a four-door silver Isuzu Rodeo near the intersection of Music and North Derbigny Street. Santinac is at least the 137th person to be murdered in New Orleans this year. By this time last year, 140 people had been murdered, according to Flot.

properties.name: 09.08, 230AM: Mark Stone, 28
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees Coroner\'s investigators have identified a 38-year-old New Orleans man police officers found shot to death Sunday morning near a Gert Town intersection. Mark Stone, 38, died of multiple gunshot wounds he sustained some time before 2:30 a.m. Sunday morning, New Orleans coroner\'s chief investigator John Gagliano said Tuesday. New Orleans Police Department officers responding to the early morning call of a shooting in the 7800 block of Olive Street found a wounded Stone lying on the ground near the intersection of Fern Street, according to information from both police spokesman Garry Flot and an NOPD incident log. New Orleans EMS paramedics pronounced him dead on the scene. -Times-Picayune

properties.name: 09.11, 10AM: Charles Dickerson, 30
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees New Orleans police are searching for a 42-year-old man in connection with a Thursday murder in the Upper 9th Ward. Detectives want to question Leroy Day about the murder of Charles Dickerson, 30, in the 1700 Block of France Street. Shortly after 10 a.m. Thursday, 5th District officers responded to a r report of a man shot and found Dickerson lying on the sidewalk, investigators have said. Dickerson was pronounced dead at the scene. -Times-Picayune

properties.name: 09.18, 6PM: Darrick Jack
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees A 19-year-old man gunned down Thursday in St. Roch was a witness in a murder case that had been scheduled to go to trial earlier this month but was postponed because of Hurricane Gustav. Darrick Jack died about 6 p.m. in the 2000 block of Franklin Avenue, shot several times in his chest, arm and back, according to police. Almost two years ago, on Oct. 18, 2006, Jack witnessed the shooting death of Milton Marcelin, 26, not far from where he died Thursday. Jack had been walking down North Rocheblave Street, heading to the store on an errand for his mother, according to a police report about the Marcelin case. As he walked in the 2000 block of North Rocheblave Street, Jack saw Kevin Harrison, 22, confront Marcelin outside a FEMA trailer next to 2050 N. Rocheblave, the report said. Harrison demanded money he believed he was owed, according to the report. Marcelin responded, "I ain\'t giving you any money, " according to the report. Harrison then pulled out a gun, firing several times. Marcelin was shot in his head and torso. Eight spent .40 caliber casings were found at the crime scene. Jack quickly walked past the shooting scene and went to the Richards Food Store on the corner, he later told police. When he left the store, Harrison was waiting for him outside. Harrison told him, "If you say something, you\'re gonna be next, " Jack told police. When interviewed by police in January 2007, Jack could not identify Harrison by name, saying he knew him as "Christopher." But he picked Harrison out of a photograph lineup and identified him as the killer in court during a preliminary hearing in April 2007, according to the court records. The second-degree murder case against Harrison was supposed to go to trial Sept. 2, but was postponed because of Hurricane Gustav, which hit the day before. A spokeswoman for Orleans Parish District Attorney Robert Freeman said the office could not comment about any aspect of the case because it is pending in court. Officer Garry Flot, a spokesman for the New Orleans Police Department, said the motive behind Jack\'s shooting is under investigation. -Times-Picayune

properties.name: 09.20: Leslie Cannon, 19

properties.name: 09.21 840PM: Darielle Rainey, 18
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees A gunman or gunmen fatally shot an 18-year-old woman -- identified by friends as a student at Eleanor McMain Secondary School -- as she sat in a blue Volkswagen in Uptown Sunday night. A 19-year old man was also wounded in the shooting. New Orleans Police arrived at the scene about 8:40 p.m. in the 1900 block of Amelia Street to find the 18 year-old victim dead from multiple gunshot wounds, said Officer Garry Flot. Late Sunday, chief coroner\'s investigator John Gagliano identified the victim as Darielle Rainey. A friend of Rainey\'s at the scene, along with a classmate, said Rainey was a junior at McMain. Orleans Parish School Board Superintendent Darryl Kilbert couldn\'t be reached late Sunday to confirm whether Rainey attended the Uptown school. The shots that killed Rainey and wounded the unidentified 19-year-old came from a red Dodge pickup truck occupied by several people, Flot said. Police found the 19 year-old lying on the sidewalk near the car, Flot said. Police said the people in the Dodge drove away. -Times-Picayune

properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees A 23-year-old man was shot and killed next to his idling car at about 2:40 p.m. today in eastern New Orleans. The shooting took place at about 2:40 p.m. in the 6000 block of Beechcraft Drive, a cul-de-sac off of Downman Road. The man fell next to his car, his white t-shirt stained in blood. He was pronounced dead at the scene. His identity has not been released. The murder occurred about 50 yards away from a double murder in June. Tremika Bingham, 27, and Christopher Williams, 38, were both shot inside a sport-utility vehicle on June 5. -The Times-Picayune

properties.name: 11.15, 5AM: David Williams, 49
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees The man killed during an apparent hit-and-run in Gert Town early Saturday was David Williams, 49, said coroner\'s chief investigator John Gagliano on Tuesday. Williams, a Carrollton man, was found dead about 5 a.m. in the 7700 block of Colapissa Street, lying in the roadway with tire marks across his torso, according to the New Orleans Police Department. It appears a truck may have hit him, according to a preliminary incident log from the NOPD. A garbage truck driver working on the block spotted him and called authorities. -Times-Picayune

properties.name: 11.17, 9PM: Kendrick Thomas, 22
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees Thomas\' is the second killing in three days in this city that occurred near an inoperable crime camera. The first was Brian Thickstin, 37, who was fatally shot Saturday night in the 2800 block of Chippewa Street in the Irish Channel. Mayor Ray Nagin\'s spokeswoman, Ceeon Quiett, confirmed that both cameras don\'t work -- along with scores of others in the city. She blamed the camera damage on Hurricane Gustav and said the city has started repairing them and will repair all of them soon. But complaints about inoperable -- or merely ineffective and expensive -- crime cameras have dogged the city since it launched the controversial crime-fighting effort. Ricks stood near the camera that might have captured the killing of his 22-year-old stepson. A green van traveled down the 2400 block of North Villere Street shortly before 9 p.m. Monday, unleashing the bullets that felled Thomas and wounded two others. Ricks sipped from a sweaty beer can and paced the sidewalk. His family knows that only about half of all murders end in an arrest -- and substantially fewer end in convictions. They know evidence is often scarce, witnesses often scared. They don\'t know why the camera on the corner -- a tool the mayor once pitched as the unassailable witness -- does not work. -The Times-Picayune

properties.name: 11.19, 530PM: Kevin Jarrow
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees A 33-year-old man shot Wednesday evening in West Carrollton neighborhood died from his wounds early Thursday morning, and now, it is up to his family to raise the three children he left behind. Kevin Jarrow, a New Orleans man who enjoyed carpentry and fixing cars, died at University Hospital at 3 a.m., according to John Gagliano, the coroner\'s chief investigator. Paramedics rushed Jarrow to the hospital shortly after someone shot him multiple times on the corner of Green and Hollygrove streets, not far from Jerry\'s Grocery, at about 5:30 p.m. Wednesday. When the shooting happened, Jarrow was hanging out with his friend Burnell Brock, 23, who was found dead on the side of a house in the nearby 9000 block of Green Street three hours after the shooting, said Tony Savoy, Jarrow\'s stepbrother. NOPD spokeswoman Officer Shereese Harper said Friday that investigators are treating Jarrow\'s shooting and the discovery of Brock\'s body as separate incidents. Jarrow leaves behind three children, ages 10, 8 and 7, Savoy said. He had been raising the children mostly on his own because their mother never played much of a role in their lives, Savoy said. Jarrow, who attended Alcee Fortier High School, had a criminal record dating back to 1992, when he was convicted of burglary and illegally carrying a concealed weapon, according to court records. In 1996, he spent time behind bars for possessing crack cocaine. Though a lull in his criminal troubles coincided with the birth of his children, he was in trouble again in 2002, when he pled guilty to an attempted possession of a firearm charge. In 2006, he faced weapons and drug charges, but prosecutors declined to pursue the case. With the help of his family, he tried his best to raise his children, Savoy said. Jarrow, an automobile mechanic, was able to send his kids to school by fixing cars on his own and by working for local body shops. He also took on carpentry jobs to pay for their schooling, Savoy said. During his down time, Jarrow would take his three kids to the park and play with them. When relaxing indoors, the 33-year-old gearhead would leaf through automobile books and magazines with them, teaching them what motors were in what cars. Savoy said he, his sister and mother will split the duties of raising the children. "We\'re family," he said. "We can\'t leave them stuck out. They\'ve been crying a little bit, but they\'re handling it. We\'ll stay close to them." Ramon Antonio Vargas can be reached at rvargas@timespicayune.com. -The Times-Picayune

properties.name: 11.21, 1130AM: male, mid-20's
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees One man was killed and another wounded this afternoon in a shooting near the intersection of Cambronne and Spruce streets in the Carrollton neighborhood, police said. While there is still no information about exactly what led to the shooting, a police spokeswoman said the deceased was found in an alley between shotgun houses near the intersection. He was in his mid-20s. A second victim was taken to a hospital in fair condition, she said. New Orleans police swarmed the area after the shooting, blocking several streets as residents gathered outside. -The Times-Picayune

properties.name: 12.13 1PM: Unidentified Triple (1 Tranny)
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees Three men found shot to death in 7th Ward house by Brendan McCarthy, The Times-Picayune Saturday December 13, 2008, 2:53 PM Three men were found shot to death at about 1 p.m. today inside a house in the 2500 block of Pauger Street. New Orleans Police Superintendent Warren Riley was at the triple murder scene and was briefed by patrol officers. Riley said that three people, all apparently men, were found shot inside the home. One of the victims was dressed in women\'s attire, he said. Riley noted that the investigation is in the preliminary stages and that it would take time for crime scene technicians to process the area. The shotgun double home sits in the middle of the block. It is unclear when the shooting took place. A maintenance man doing repairs on one half of the coffee-colored house said he peered into the home and saw a man\'s body sprawled on the floor and called 911. The police arrived minutes later and began the homicide investigation.

properties.name: 12.15 2:20AM: 2 shot, 1 killed @ Club Hush
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees Police arrested a 20-year-old Gretna man with the shooting of a man and a woman at a Decatur Street club in the French Quarter early Monday morning, booking Narkee Hunter with first-degree murder and attempted murder. The man died and an 18-year-old woman was sent to the hospital during the aftermath of a shooting that occurred around 2:20 a.m. at Club Hush, 309 Decatur St., the New Orleans Police Department said. The club was formerly known as Club Dream. A police log said a security guard apprehended a man with a gun fleeing the club just after the shooting. Police spokeswoman Shereese Harper said this man was Hunter. In a news release, Harper said Hunter\'s arrest can be credited in part to citizen cooperation with homicide detectives. The man, who New Orleans EMS paramedics pronounced dead inside the French Quarter nightclub, appeared to be around 20 years old, said Jeb Tate, an EMS spokesman. John Gagliano, the chief investigator for the Orleans Parish coroner\'s office, said they are still working on identifying the man. The woman, who had been shot in the abdomen, was taken to University Hospital in stable condition. Paramedics took three others to Tulane Hospital with minor injuries they sustained as they tried to escape the club, Tate said. -The Times-Picayune

properties.name: 12.17 530PM: Brian Urby, 17
properties.description: Posted by Nolafugees What sounded like an argument to neighbors led to the shooting death of a Sarah T. Reed High School student Wedensday night in eastern New Orleans. Brian Urby, 17, was shot in the chest while standing under a tree in the 7100 block of Bunker Hill Road about 5:30 p.m., according to authorities and neighbors. New Orleans EMS spokesman Jeb Tate said paramedics rushed the teenager to University Hospital. He died before arriving, according to John Gagliano, the New Orleans coroner\'s chief investigator. Neighbors milling around the scene Wednesday said they heard shouting before gunfire broke out. Several people were apparently gathered at the home, hanging out, when the 17-year-old was shot. Recovery School District Superintendent Paul Vallas confirmed Urby was a student at Reed. While the slaying happened about eight miles from the school, Vallas said the district will have its crisis counselors and additional security on campus Thursday. -Times-Picayune
